sen.j: 上御霊神社（かみごりょうじんじゃ）は、京都市上京区にある神社である。
sen.e: Kami-goryo-jinja Shrine is located in Kamigyo Ward, Kyoto City.
Kami-goryo-jinja Shrine is located in Kamigyo Ward, Kyoto City.
Kami-goryo-jinja Shrine is located in Kamigyo Ward, Kyoto City.

sen.j: 旧社格は府社。
sen.e: It formerly held the rank of Prefectural Shrine.
It formerly held the rank of Prefectural Shrine.
It formerly held the rank of Prefectural Shrine.

sen.j: 上御霊神社という社名は下御霊神社に対応するもので、現在は宗教法人としての正式名を「御靈神社」としている。
sen.e: The name Kami-goryo-jinja Shrine corresponds to that of Shimo-goryo-jinja Shrine and its current formal name as a religious corporation is Goryo-jinja Shrine.
The name Kami-goryo-jinja Shrine corresponds to that of Shimo-goryo-jinja Shrine and its current formal name as a religious corporation is Goryo-jinja Shrine.
The name Kami-goryo-jinja Shrine corresponds to that of Shimo-goryo-jinja Shrine and its current formal name as a religious corporation is Goryo-jinja Shrine.

sen.j: 祭神
sen.e: Enshrined Deity
Enshrined Deity
Enshrined Deity

sen.j: 現在の祭神は以下の八柱で、「八所御霊」と称される。
sen.e: The following eight deities known as "Hassho-goryo" are enshrined withing the shrine.
The following eight deities known as "Hassho-goryo" are enshrined within the shrine.
The following eight deities known as "Hassho-goryo" are enshrined within the shrine.

sen.j: 崇道天皇（早良親王。光仁天皇の皇子）
sen.e: The Emperor Sudo (the Imperial prince Sawara)
sen.cmt: 崇道天皇、光仁天皇：英辞郎 on the WEB (-天皇、-親王)
sen.e: The Emperor Sudo (the Imperial prince Sawara, son of Emperor Konin)
sen.cmt: セル12と続いています。son of Emperor Konin)を補足。
sen.e: The Emperor Sudo (the Imperial prince Sawara, son of Emperor Konin)

sen.j: 井上内親王（光仁天皇の皇后）
sen.e: The Imperial princess Inoe
The Imperial princess Inoe (wife of Emperor Konin)
The Imperial princess Inoe (wife of Emperor Konin)

sen.j: 他戸親王（光仁天皇の皇子）
sen.e: The Imperial prince Osabe
The Imperial prince Osabe (son of Emperor Konin)
The Imperial prince Osabe (son of Emperor Konin)

sen.j: 藤原大夫神（藤原広嗣）
sen.e: Fujiwara-no-Taifujin (FUJIWARA no Hirotsugu)
Fujiwara-no-Taifujin (FUJIWARA no Hirotsugu)
Fujiwara-no-Taifujin (FUJIWARA no Hirotsugu)

sen.j: 橘大夫（橘逸勢）
sen.e: Tachibana-no-Taibu (TACHIBANA no Hayanari)
Tachibana-no-Taibu (TACHIBANA no Hayanari)
Tachibana-no-Taibu (TACHIBANA no Hayanari)

sen.j: 文大夫（文室宮田麻呂）
sen.e: Bun-no-Taibu (FUN'YA no Miyatamaro)
Bun-no-Taibu (FUN'YA no Miyatamaro)
Bun-no-Taibu (FUNYA no Miyatamaro)

sen.j: 火雷神（以上六柱の荒魂。菅原道真とも）
sen.e: Karaishin (the following 6 aggressive souls and SUGAWARA no Michizane).
Karaishin (the above 6 aggressive souls and also known as SUGAWARA no Michizane).
sen.cmt: following→above 六柱: 上記六名の神を指している。and→and also known as
sen.e: Karaishin (the above 6 aggressive souls and also known as SUGAWARA no Michizane).

sen.j: 吉備大臣（吉備真備。吉備聖霊ともいう）
sen.e: Kibi-no-Ototo (also known as KIBI no Makibi and Kibi-no-shoryo).
Kibi-no-Otodo (also known as KIBI no Makibi and Kibi-no-shoryo).
sen.cmt: Ototo→Otodo デジタル大辞泉その他より
sen.e: Kibi-no-Otodo (also known as KIBI no Makibi and Kibi-no-shoryo).

sen.j: 八所御霊の内容については諸説あり、上記のほか伊予親王（桓武天皇の御子）、藤原夫人（伊予親王の母、藤原吉子）、観察使（藤原仲成か）とされることもある。
sen.e: There are various opinions regarding the deities of the Hassho-goryo and, in addition to those given above, Imperial prince Iyo (son of Emperor Kammu), Lady FUJIWARA (FUJIWARA no Yoshiko, mother of Imperial prince Iyo) and an administrative inspector (FUJIWARA no Nakanari) are also considered to be included.
sen.cmt: 伊予親王、桓武天皇：英辞郎 on the WEB
sen.e: There are various opinions regarding the deities of the Hassho-goryo and, in addition to those given above, Imperial prince Iyo (son of Emperor Kammu), Lady FUJIWARA (FUJIWARA no Yoshiko, mother of Imperial prince Iyo) and an administrative inspector (FUJIWARA no Nakanari) are also considered to be included.

There are various opinions regarding the deities of the Hassho-goryo and, in addition to those given above, Imperial prince Iyo (son of Emperor Kanmmu), Lady FUJIWARA (FUJIWARA no Yoshiko, mother of Imperial prince Iyo) and an administrative inspector (FUJIWARA no Nakanari) are also considered to be included.

sen.j: 相殿に小倉実起・小倉公連・中納言典待局・小倉季判、若宮に和光明神（菅原和子）を配祀する。
sen.e: Aidono (subordinate altars) enshrine Saneoki OGURA, Kimitsura OGURA, Chunagon Tenji-no-tsubone and Noritomo OGURA, and a Wakamiya (subordinate shrine) enshrine Wako-myojin (SUGAWARA no Kazuko).
sen.cmt: 中納言典待局、和光明神（菅原和子）：http://www.kyoto-jinjacho.or.jp/shrine/02/004/index.html
sen.e: Aidono (subordinate altars) enshrine Saneoki OGURA, Kimitsura OGURA, Chunagon Tenji-no-tsubone and Noritomo OGURA, and a Wakamiya (subordinate shrine) enshrine Wako-myojin (SUGAWARA no Kazuko).

Aidono (subordinate altars) enshrine Saneoki OGURA, Kimitsura OGURA, Chunagon (vice-councilor of state) Tenji-no-tsubone and Noritomo OGURA, and a Wakamiya (subordinate shrine) enshrine Wako-myojin (SUGAWARA no Kazuko).

sen.j: これらの諸神は（吉備真備を除いて）いずれも政争に巻き込まれて憤死した人々で、その怨霊を慰めるために創建されたのが当社である。
sen.e: These kami (with the exception of KIBI no Makibi) all lost their lives in political struggles and this shrine was constructed in order to comfort their vengeful spirits.
sen.cmt: 「いづれも」を「いずれも」に訂正
sen.e: These kami (with the exception of KIBI no Makibi) all lost their lives in political struggles and this shrine was constructed in order to comfort their vengeful spirits.
These kami (with the exception of KIBI no Makibi) all lost their lives in political struggles and this shrine was constructed in order to comfort their vengeful spirits.

sen.j: 歴史
sen.e: History
History
History

sen.j: 桓武天皇の時代、各地で疫病が流行した。
sen.e: Plague was rife during the reign of Emperor Kammu.
Plague was rife during the reign of Emperor Kammu.
Plague was rife during the reign of Emperor Kanmu.

sen.j: これは御霊信仰の祟りであるとして、貞観 (日本)5年（863年）5月20日、平安京の神泉苑で御霊会が催された。
sen.e: Believing it to be a curse brought by goryo (vengeful ghosts), a goryo-e (ritual to repose the souls of the dead) was held on 20th May 863 at Shinsen'en in the city of Heian-Kyo.
sen.cmt: 平安京：英辞郎 on the WEB
sen.e: Believing it to be a curse brought by goryo (vengeful ghosts), a goryo-e (ritual to repose the souls of the dead) was held on 20th May 863 at Shinsen'en in the city of Heian-Kyo.
Believing it to be a curse brought by goryo (vengeful ghosts), a goryo-e (ritual to repose the souls of the dead) was held on May 20, 863 at Shinsenen in the city of Heian-Kyo.
sen.cmt: 日付の表記を他ファイルと合わせる。"Shinsen'en"→"Shinsenen"に変更しました。

sen.j: この時に慰霊された御霊は崇道天皇・伊予親王・藤原夫人・観察使（藤原仲成）・橘逸勢・文屋宮田麿らであった。
sen.e: The goryo to be comforted were those of the Emperor Sudo, Imperial prince Iyo, Lady FUJIWARA, the administrative inspector (FUJIWARA no Nakanari), TACHIBANA no Hayanari and Bunya no Miyatamaro.
The goryo to be comforted were those of the Emperor Sudo, Imperial prince Iyo, Lady FUJIWARA, the administrative inspector (FUJIWARA no Nakanari), TACHIBANA no Hayanari and FUN'YA no Miyatamaro.
sen.cmt: FUN'YA no Miyatamaro: Glossaryその他より
sen.e: The goryo to be comforted were those of the Emperor Sudo, Imperial Prince Iyo, Lady FUJIWARA, the administrative inspector (FUJIWARA no Nakanari), TACHIBANA no Hayanari and FUNYA no Miyatamaro.
sen.cmt: "Imperial prince"→"Imperial Prince"に変更しました。"FUN'YA"→"FUNYA"に変更しました。

sen.j: この御霊会が当社および下御霊神社の創祀であるとしている。
sen.e: It is believed that this ritual was the founding of both this shrine and Shimo-goryo-jinja Shrine.
It is believed that this ritual was the founding of both this shrine and Shimo-goryo-jinja Shrine.
It is believed that this ritual was the founding of both this shrine and Shimo-goryo-jinja Shrine.

sen.j: 現在の下御霊神社を下出雲寺御霊堂、当社は上出雲寺御霊堂と称した。
sen.e: The present Shimo-goryo-jinja Shrine was given the name Shimotsuidumo-dera Temple Goryo-do and this shrine was named Kamiizumo-dera Temple Goryo-do.
The present Shimo-goryo-jinja Shrine was given the name Shimo-izumo-dera Temple Goryo-do Hall and this shrine was named Kami-izumo-dera Temple Goryo-do Hall.
The present Shimo-goryo-jinja Shrine was given the name Shimo-izumo-dera Temple Goryo-do Hall and this shrine was named Kami-izumo-dera Temple Goryo-do Hall.

sen.j: 朝廷の篤い崇敬を受け、至徳 (日本)元年には正一位の神階を授けられた。
sen.e: They received the deep reverence of the Imperial Court and in 1384 were awarded the highest rank that could be bestowed upon a shrine.
They received the deep reverence of the Imperial Court and in 1384 were awarded the highest rank 'Sho-ichii' that could be bestowed upon a shrine.
They received the deep reverence of the Imperial Court and in 1384 were awarded the highest rank Shoichii (Senior First Rank) that could be bestowed upon a shrine.
sen.cmt: 表記を変更'Shoichii'→"Shoichii (Senior First Rank)"に変更しました。

sen.j: 室町時代の文正2年（1467年）1月18日、失脚した管領の畠山政長と畠山義就との私闘が当社境内の森で行われた。
sen.e: On 18th January 1467, during the Muromachi Period, the struggle between deposed Kanrei (Shogun's Deputy) Masanaga HATAKEYAMA and Yoshinari HATAKEYAMA took place in the forest within this shrine.
On 18th January 1467, during the Muromachi Period, the struggle between deposed Kanrei (Shogun's Deputy) Masanaga HATAKEYAMA and Yoshinari HATAKEYAMA took place in the forest within this shrine.
On January 18, 1467, during the Muromachi Period, the struggle between deposed Kanrei (Shogun's Deputy) Masanaga HATAKEYAMA and Yoshinari HATAKEYAMA took place in the forest within this shrine.
sen.cmt: 日付の表記を他のファイルと合わせる。

sen.j: 御霊合戦は翌年勃発の応仁の乱の前哨戦となり、応仁の乱発祥の地とされる。
sen.e: The Goryo skirmish led to the outbreak of the Onin War in the following year and this is considered the site where the Onin War began.
sen.cmt: 応仁の乱：英辞郎 on the WEB
sen.e: The Goryo skirmish led to the outbreak of the Onin War in the following year and this is considered the site where the Onin War began.
The Goryo skirmish led to the outbreak of the Onin War in the following year and this is considered the site where the Onin War began.

sen.j: なお、延喜式神名帳に記載される出雲井於神社（式内大社）や出雲高野神社（式内小社）を当社に比定する説もあるが、継続性は不詳であり、神社側の由諸ではこれらの式内社について言及していない。
sen.e: There are theories that claim the actual shrine to be either Izumo-Inoe-jinja Shrine (Shikinai-taisha) or Izumo-Takano-jinja Shrine (Shikinai-shosha) which are listed in the Jimmyocho (the list of deities) of Engishiki (codes and procedures on national rites and prayers), but continuity is unclear and the history record held at the shrine makes no reference to these shrines from the Enkishiki.

There are theories that claim the actual shrine to be either Izumo-Inoe-jinja Shrine (Shikinai-taisha) or Izumo-Takano-jinja Shrine (Shikinai-shosha) which are listed in the Jimmyocho (the list of deities) of Engishiki (codes and procedures on national rites and prayers), but continuity is unclear and the history record held at the shrine makes no reference to these shrines from the Engishiki.

There are theories that claim the actual shrine to be either Izumo-Inoe-jinja Shrine (Shikinai-taisha) or Izumo-Takano-jinja Shrine (Shikinai-shosha) which are listed in the Jimmyocho (the list of deities) of Engishiki (codes and procedures on national rites and prayers), but continuity is unclear and the history record held at the shrine makes no reference to these shrines from the Engishiki.

sen.j: 祭事
sen.e: Festivals
Festivals
Festivals

sen.j: 例祭の御霊祭は明治までは8月18日 (旧暦)に行われていたが、現在では5月18日（新暦）に行われている。
sen.e: Until the Meiji period, the annual Goryo Festival was every 18th August (under the old lunisolar calendar) but is now held every 18th May.
Until the Meiji period, the annual Goryo Festival was every 18th August (under the old lunisolar calendar) but is now held every 18th May.
Until the Meiji period, the annual Goryo Festival was every 18th August (under the old lunisolar calendar) but is now held every 18th May.

sen.j: 御霊祭は京都（洛中）で最も古い祭りと言われる。
sen.e: The Goryo Festival is said to be the oldest festival in Kyoro (city).
The Goryo Festival is said to be the oldest festival in Kyoro (city).
The Goryo Festival is said to be the oldest festival in Kyoto (city).

sen.j: 交通
sen.e: Access
Access
Access

sen.j: 最寄駅 : 京都市営地下鉄烏丸線鞍馬口駅下車、徒歩3分
sen.e: Nearest station: Take the Karasuma Line of the Kyoto Municipal Subway to Kuramaguchi Station and walk for 3 minutes.
sen.cmt: 「京都市営地下鉄」を１つ削除京都市営地下鉄：http://www.city.kyoto.jp/koho/eng/access/transport.html
sen.e: Nearest station: Take the Karasuma Line of the Kyoto Municipal Subway to Kuramaguchi Station and walk for 3 minutes.
Nearest station: Take the Karasuma Line of the Kyoto Municipal Subway to Kuramaguchi Station and walk for 3 minutes.
